How should schools adapt to tools like ChatGPT?
text:
I believe that for most simple writing assignments in K-12, ChatGPT is pretty adept at spitting out a result that would yield a somewhat decent grade.

If you were a teacher, given what you know about ChatGPT, among other tools, and how it will become more and more proficient, how would you structure your classroom to sidestep the concern?

I would probably lean towards in-class debates, where students have a day or two to prepare, but push the topics into more philosophical territories, rather than debates using just simply facts. Thoughts?

title: Charts: Tesla stock tanks even as it sets EV delivery record
Ask HN: What's your home network setup?
text:
I have always been interested in home networking and I've quite enjoyed my minimal all-in-one solution for a long time but with more and more devices connected to the network I feel like it's getting outdated and out of hands.

My current setup includes a 4G LTE modem (no better solution in my area unfortunately) connected to a FRITZ!Box 4040 router to which every device jumps on.

With this setup I am able to do simple stuff like DynDNS/VPN and route DNS traffic to my self-hosted AdGuardHome device but I'm not quite there yet.

Next step is to gather some info and start working on network partitioning and VLANs to isolate specific devices.

I'm trying to get some ideas so I'd like to know what's your home network setup

Show HN: Under-control, lib that makes React components controlled
text: Are you losing sanity every time you need to make a form? Are you tired enough of all antipatterns and cursed React frameworks? Screw that! Treat all forms and inputs as a recursive composable controls! under-control is a lightweight alternative to libraries such as react-hook-form, formik, react-ts-form, which, unlike them, allows you to turn your components into controllable controls.

Ask HN: Google Pixel phones don't support VoLTE and 5G in most countries
text:
I've just been bitten by this, but it looks like Google blocks VoLTE and 5G in 'unsupported' countries [1][2][3], i.e. countries where Google doesn't 'officially' sell Pixels (whatever that means). So even though your operator and SIM support VoLTE, it might be artificially blocked by Google. This seems to be a know issue for a while now and can be resolved by rooting and enabling VoLTE/5G through modem configs, carrier settings, etc. [4]

I know it's futile, but is there any way to get Google to address this?

[1] https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/131223790?hl=en

[2] https://support.google.com/pixelphone/thread/78464113/pixel-volte-and-5g-support?hl=en

[3] https://support.google.com/pixelphone/search?q=enable+volte&from_promoted_search=true

[4] One example: https://github.com/swangjang/Pixel-Redbull-Carrier-Patch
